raw.title: [BIP-559] Enable ezETH / wstETH [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/840

**Summary:**
Renzo Protocol proposes a Balancer Gauge for a ezETH-wstETH pool on Arbitrum, with uncapped emissions. This will serve as a 100% yield bearing pair.

**References/Useful links:**

* Website: https://www.renzoprotocol.com
* Documentation: https://docs.renzoprotocol.com
* Github: [Renzo-Protocol · GitHub](https://github.com/renzo-protocol)
* Discord: [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/renzo)
* Twitter: https://twitter.com/RenzoProtocol
* $ezETH Token (Arbitrum): [ezETH (Renzo Restaked ETH) Token Tracker | Arbiscan](https://arbiscan.io/token/0x2416092f143378750bb29b79ed961ab195cceea5)
* Dune Dashboards: https://dune.com/maybeYonas/renzo-protocol

**Protocol Description:**

[$ezETH] is a Liquid Restaking token and Strategy Manager for EigenLayer

Renzo is the interface to the EigenLayer ecosystem securing Actively Validated Services (AVSs), offering a higher yield than ETH staking.

Renzo introduces the Balancer Gauge for the Renzo [ezETH/wstETH 50/50 pool]. ezETH, Renzo’s liquid restaking token (LRT), captures rewards, ensures liquidity, and simplifies reward management with AVSs. This approach ensures a user-friendly DeFi experience where participants deposit ETH into the liquidity pool, mint ezETH, accumulate rewards, and seamlessly engage in other DeFi activities. Renzo is on a trajectory toward a permissionless validator set, emphasizing composability in DeFi.

**Motivation:**

Renzo is seeking to establish the [ezETH/wstETH 50/50 pool] on Arbitrum on Balancer to further enrich liquidity for ezETH. This move aims to enhance the trading experience across the Ethereum ecosystem, making it more accessible for users while generating additional value to the Renzo community.

**Specifications:**
 
Governance:

Renzo currently operates with a multi-signature wallet, featuring doxxed founding contributors. The protocol is planning to decentralize strategy management to ezPoints holders and transition to decentralized governance in the future.

Oracles:

Renzo uses ChainLink oracles to price assets (besides ETH) held in the protocol, and in the future, ChainLink will also be used to price assets withdrawn from Renzo.

Audits:

Renzo smart contracts have been audited by Halborn. All of Renzo’s smart contracts are open source.Audits can be found here: [https://github.com/HalbornSecurity/PublicReports/blob/master/Solidity Smart Contract Audits/Renzo_Protocol_EVM_Contracts_Smart_Contract_Security_Assessment_Report_Halborn_Final.pdf](https://github.com/HalbornSecurity/PublicReports/blob/master/Solidity)

Centralization vectors:

Centralization vectors currently revolve around the Oracle, validator management via Figment, upgradeability via proxy multisig contract, and front end hosting.

Market history:

Renzo currently has two pools live on Balancer [ezETH / WETH](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x596192bb6e41802428ac943d2f1476c1af25cc0e000000000000000000000659) and the [LRT tri-pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x848a5564158d84b8a8fb68ab5d004fae11619a5400000000000000000000066a). Both pools are in the top 6 on Balancer on Ethereum by TVL.

Renzo strives to be the most secure and efficient liquid restaking token across DeFi and on Ethereum L2s. Renzo is currently focused on diversification efforts to increase the number of node operators on EigenLayer, increasing decentralization and improving security for Actively Validated Services (AVS). Renzo is also working on supporting various LSTs deposits through the platform and building partnerships/integrations across aggregators, DEXs, bridges, Oracle providers, L2s, and other DeFi projects.

Value: The ezETH/wstETH pool on Balancer is intended to serve as a primary liquidity source for the token on Arbitrum.

ezETH on Arbitrum: [0x2416092f143378750bb29b79eD961ab195CcEea5](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x2416092f143378750bb29b79eD961ab195CcEea5)

ezETH/wstETH Arbitrum pool on Balancer: https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x7a66b9ef65a88e9abc94a08c9b043e73685d850b000000000000000000000517

Child chain gauge: [0x7C4A6B0c16cA99e65822Cc531403cE2f8A20A912](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7C4A6B0c16cA99e65822Cc531403cE2f8A20A912#code) Mainnet root gauge: [0xCD41Bc6DC6e9821C4C36848Ff3397493e458A5d1](https://etherscan.io/address/0xCD41Bc6DC6e9821C4C36848Ff3397493e458A5d1#code)

### Specification

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0xCD41Bc6DC6e9821C4C36848Ff3397493e458A5d1`

gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-505] Enable 40DFX-20USDC-40TEL Gauge with 2% emissions cap
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/681

**Summary:**
DFX Finance’s proposal to add a gauge for the 40DFX-20USDC-40TEL - Polygon

**References/Useful links:**
Link to:
Website: [Main Website](https://dfx.finance/), [dApp](https://app.dfx.finance/)

• Documentation: [Gitbook](https://docs.dfx.finance/), [Medium](https://medium.com/@dfxfinance)

• Github Page: [Github](https://github.com/dfx-finance)

**Protocol Description:**

DFX Finance is a decentralized foreign exchange (FX) protocol that facilitates the seamless exchange of fiat-backed stablecoins denominated in a growing number of currencies. Using a hyper-efficient AMM, optimized for low volatility trading, DFX provides FX swaps with rates that will beat any bank, money changer, or FX platform. DFX is the governance token of DFX Finance which allows users to vote on protocol changes and initiatives of the DAO, and also allows users to receive boosted emissions on deposits within the DFX ecosystem.

**Price History DFX:**

Price History for DFX can be found on [Coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dfx-finance)

**Motivation:**

The DFX token on L2s such as Arbitrum and Polygon is migrating from a bridged token to a Chainlink CCIP token. As well, DFX Finance is committed to continue to engage in the Hiddenhand Finance ecosystem in a meaningful way to further deepen DFX liquidity onchain.

**Specifications:**

1. Governance: DFX tokens serve as the governance token for the DFX Finance protocol. DFX token holders can vote on governance proposals through DFX’s snapshot. DFX forum is also used to discuss potential protocol changes and improvements.
2. Oracles: DFX token does not rely on any external oracles. The DFX stablecoin pools uses Chainlink for its real world forex price feeds to facilitate efficient stablecoin swaps close to the spot price. The feeds can be found here: [Decentralized Price Reference Data | Chainlink](https://data.chain.link/ethereum/mainnet/fiat)
3. Audits: DFX has engaged with multiple auditors including engagements with Trail of Bits, Haechi, and Zellic to audit the DFX smart contracts.
4. Centralization vectors: Treasury functions are controlled by a 2/4 multisig including treasury yield farming, and paying bribes.
5. Market History: DFX has been transferable since March 2021.
6. Value: This pool will be the primary source of liquidity for DFX on Arbitrum and Polygon

**40DFX-20USDC-40TEL - Polygon**
Pool: [0xc260f3c5a57caf193d1813d8fd0a02442073d6fa](https://polygonscan.com/address/0xc260f3c5a57caf193d1813d8fd0a02442073d6fa)
Gauge: [0x15639b2F9159DFD4ACF8eCf56222421ead906826](https://polygonscan.com/address/0x15639b2F9159DFD4ACF8eCf56222421ead906826)
Root Gauge: [0xe9b5f4d892Df284a15Ec90A58bd4385E57964f18](https://etherscan.io/address/0xe9b5f4d892Df284a15Ec90A58bd4385E57964f18)

**Specification**:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xe9b5f4d892Df284a15Ec90A58bd4385E57964f18`
gaugeType(string): `Polygon`

choices: No, this is not the way

### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/674

**Summary:**

DFX Finance’s proposal to (1) add a gauge for the DFX(L2)/ETH 50/50 on Arbitrum (2) deprecate the gauge for the DFX/ETH 50/50 on Arbitrum

References/Useful links:

Link to:
Website: [Main Website](https://dfx.finance/), [dApp](https://app.dfx.finance/)

• Documentation: [Gitbook](https://docs.dfx.finance/), [Medium](https://medium.com/@dfxfinance)

• Github Page: [Github](https://github.com/dfx-finance)

**Protocol Description:**

DFX Finance is a decentralized foreign exchange (FX) protocol that facilitates the seamless exchange of fiat-backed stablecoins denominated in a growing number of currencies. Using a hyper-efficient AMM, optimized for low volatility trading, DFX provides FX swaps with rates that will beat any bank, money changer, or FX platform. DFX is the governance token of DFX Finance which allows users to vote on protocol changes and initiatives of the DAO, and also allows users to receive boosted emissions on deposits within the DFX ecosystem.

**Price History DFX:**

Price History for DFX can be found on [Coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dfx-finance)

**Motivation:**

The DFX token on L2s such as Arbitrum and Polygon is migrating from a bridged token to a Chainlink CCIP token. As well, DFX Finance is committed to continue to engage in the Hiddenhand Finance ecosystem in a meaningful way to further deepen DFX liquidity onchain.

**Specifications:**

1. Governance: DFX tokens serve as the governance token for the DFX Finance protocol. DFX token holders can vote on governance proposals through DFX’s snapshot. DFX forum is also used to discuss potential protocol changes and improvements.
2. Oracles: DFX token does not rely on any external oracles. The DFX stablecoin pools uses Chainlink for its real world forex price feeds to facilitate efficient stablecoin swaps close to the spot price. The feeds can be found here: [Decentralized Price Reference Data | Chainlink](https://data.chain.link/ethereum/mainnet/fiat)
3. Audits: DFX has engaged with multiple auditors including engagements with Trail of Bits, Haechi, and Zellic to audit the DFX smart contracts.
4. Centralization vectors: Treasury functions are controlled by a 2/4 multisig including treasury yield farming, and paying bribes.
5. Market History: DFX has been transferable since March 2021.
6. Value: This pool will be the primary source of liquidity for DFX on Arbitrum and Polygon

DFX(L2)/ETH 50/50 - Arbitrum
Pool: [0x9bfcd4189cf9062697746ce292350f42fdee457c](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x9bfcd4189cf9062697746ce292350f42fdee457c)
Gauge: [0x574c2146091Cced305A7ABa82d097DE36b736fac](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x574c2146091Cced305A7ABa82d097DE36b736fac)
Root Gauge: [0x5b006e53df539773e109DBbf392dEfF6E87E2781](https://etherscan.io/address/0x5b006e53df539773e109DBbf392dEfF6E87E2781)

**Specifications**: 

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x5b006e53df539773e109DBbf392dEfF6E87E2781`
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

2 weeks after execution of the above

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the `data(bytes)` argument and the `0x8f7a0f9cf545db78bf5120d3dbea7de9c6220c10` list for the `target(address)` argument.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-563] Enable SYNO/wETH 80/20 Gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/846

**Summary:**
> This is a proposal to enable Balancer Gauge for SYNO/wETH 80/20 pool on Arbitrum.
Synonym Finance launched in February of 2024, achieved a TVL in the protocol of $10M+ and achieved a liquidity of $1M+ in the governance token pool 80SYNO-20WETH on Balancer on Arbitrum. SYNO serves as a governance token for Synonym Finance. Much like many protocols in the DeFI space, providing liquidity on Balancer and locking it on the Synonym Dapp provides users with a boost towards emissions as well as share of fees. WIth the introduction of the Gauge, BAL/AURA emissions will now further fuel the incentive for liquidity provision, amplifying the pool’s attractiveness and increasing the size of the pool even further. 


**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
Website: https://www.synonym.finance/
Documentation: Docs: https://synonym-finance.gitbook.io/synonym-finance/documentation/overview 
Github Page: https://github.com/SynonymFinance
Twitter: https://twitter.com/synonymfinance
Discord: https://discord.com/invite/synonymfinance


**Protocol Description:**

> Synonym Finance is a universal cross-chain money market built for busy DeFi Professionals. Users can lend, borrow and earn rewards across multiple chains without leaving our unified UI. Synonym is a truly cross-chain application powered by the Wormhole xChain technology stack and further enhanced by Circle CCTP. The goal of Synonym is to unify and take advantage of the liquidity fragmented across various chains. Synonym Finance launched on Arbitrum, Ethereum and Optimism Chains. 


**Motivation:**

> SYNO/wETH pool is highly important to Synonym as this pool is intended to be the primary source of liquidity on Arbitrum. Additionally, users are incentivized to provide liquidity into this pool as they will be eligible for a boost towards $SYNO emissions as well as share of the revenue. This kicks off a flow where users get emissions - lock liquidity and get even more emissions. The proposed gauge will give the chance to incentivize even higher rewards for the pool, thus increasing the liquidity of SYNO token.
The current sustainable yield for providing liquidity to the pool is around 15%. We expect to significantly increase the APR with enabling Balancer Gauge, via Aura in future. After that, the pool would naturally grow and attract even further user base into the ecosystem. Additionally, we expect to facilitate even further incentivization with Aura or alternatively Hidden Hand, our partners through a connection via Redacted Finance.


**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** Synonym Finance governance’s structure is provided [here](https://synonym-finance.gitbook.io/synonym-finance/documentation/governance).   

2. **Oracles:** Synonym Finance relies on Pyth Price Oracles.


3. **Audits:** Synonym Finance has been audited twice: by Runtime Verification and Ottersec. You can find audits [here](https://synonym-finance.gitbook.io/developer-docs/audits).

4. **Centralization vectors:** Due to our experience in the space, our governance is set in a decentralized manner and we are further looking to decentralize it even further. Forum - [here](https://forum.synonym.finance/overview). Due to the recent launch, the governance process is yet to be kicked off. The DAO is governed by the multisigs on Arbitrum and Ethereum. The smart contracts are verified, and any community member may propose changes or Improvements. There have already been proposals from the active members of the community. All contracts are available in the docs and are easily observed by members of the community.

5. **Market History:** Synonym Finance launched on 6th of February 2024. We have launched after a merger with New Order DAO and an additional raise of $1.5M from investors led by Borderless Capital. We have reached a TVL of $13M and now are expanding into new assets & chains. $SYNO has launched on the same date. Coingecko [link](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/synonym-finance). Pool link: https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xeb3e64ad9314d20bf943ac72fb69f272603f9cce0002000000000000000004f5
 
6. **Value:** The SYNO/wETH pool would be the primary source of liquidity for SYNO governance token. In addition, the Synonym DAO sees a huge value of this gauge in growing the total liquidity locked in the pool to $10M+.

Child chain gauge: [0x26634a2B85831D9916D01Fa6c2489F9c5720600a](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x26634a2B85831D9916D01Fa6c2489F9c5720600a#readContract)
Root gauge w/ 2% cap: [0xB9bB09ADCBcaE06F580DA494EE6987dbB083b45f](https://etherscan.io/address/0xB9bB09ADCBcaE06F580DA494EE6987dbB083b45f#code)

### Specification

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0xB9bB09ADCBcaE06F580DA494EE6987dbB083b45f`

gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-510] Enable sDAI and sFRAX Gauge [Ethereum & Arbitrum]
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-510] Enable sDAI and sFRAX Gauge [Ethereum & Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/693

**Summary:**
> Balancer's core focus has been yield bearing liquidity for quite some time. As of recent [sDAI](https://app.spark.fi/sdai/) and [sFRAX](https://app.frax.finance/sfrax/stake) have become popular yield bearing stablecoins in the greater defi ecosystem. This proposal is meant to enable four gauges encompassing these tokens on Ethereum and Arbitrum in stable and weighted pools. The pool will sufficiently capture which captures the yield of these tokens and creates routing for the 3 primary stablecoins and wstETH to be swapped against. The pools all will be core for Balancer.

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
    • [Maker Webiste](https://makerdao.com/en/)
    • [Documentation](https://docs.makerdao.com/)
    • [Github Page](https://github.com/makerdao/developerguides/blob/master/dai/dsr-manager-docs/dsr-manager-docs.md)    
    • [Communities](https://forum.makerdao.com/)
> Link to: 
    • [Frax Webiste](https://app.frax.finance/)
    • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-v3/sfrax)
    • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity/blob/master/src/types/constants.ts)    
    • [Communities](https://gov.frax.finance/)


**Protocol Description:**

> sDAI is part of the Maker ecosystem and utilizes the Dai Savings Rate to incentivize users to stake their DAI here https://app.spark.fi/sdai/ . 
>
>sFRAX is from the new Frax v3 ecosystem and can be utilized [here](https://app.frax.finance/sfrax/stake). 

**Motivation:**

> Balancer users will have a more capital efficient place to provide stable coin liquidity routes. As core pools these will receive BAL incentives over time via the BIP-19 cycle. sDAI and sFRAX will overall earn the DAO more revenue and strengthen the routing for swaps on Balancer using the underlying tokens.  

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** Maker DAO is a complex and robust Defi ecosystem. Their current governance module can be seen [here](https://docs.makerdao.com/smart-contract-modules/governance-module). Frax governance is outlined [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-governance/frax-governance-overview). 

2. **Oracles:** This pool relies on the [SavingsDAIRateProvider](https://0xc7177B6E18c1Abd725F5b75792e5F7A3bA5DBC2c) to account for the yield accrued by sDAI. This have been reviewed and deemed SAFE by the integrations team [here](https://github.com/threerocks-defi/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/SavingsDAIRateProvider.md). The sFRAX and wstETH oracles utilize the Chainlink feed factory or have been proven by being utilized for over a year on the platform. 

3. **Audits:** MakerDAO audit reports can be seen [here](https://security.makerdao.com/audit-reports). Frax Finance Audits can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits). 

4. **Centralization vectors:** Maker Governance is decentralized and has no apparent centralization vectors. The underlying stablecoins USDT, DAI, and USDC are also exposed to their own centralization risks.

5. **Market History:** sDAI history can be seen on [coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/savings-dai). sFRAX history can be seen [here](https://www.geckoterminal.com/eth/pools/0xfef79304c80a694dfd9e603d624567d470e1a0e7?utm_source=coingecko&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=searchresults). 
 
6. **Value:** Yield bearing assets increase the value proposition for liquidity providers, and the revenue for the DAO when properly configured. These pools will grow stablecoin and wstETH liquidity for Balancer, while tapping into the yield source of sDAI and sFRAX.

sDAI/3Pool - Mainnet
Pool: [0x49cbD67651fbabCE12d1df18499896ec87BEf46f](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x49cbd67651fbabce12d1df18499896ec87bef46f00000000000000000000064a)
Gauge: [0xF6A7ad46b00300344C7d4739C0518db70e722DC4](https://etherscan.io/address/0xF6A7ad46b00300344C7d4739C0518db70e722DC4)

sDAI/wstETH - Mainnet
Pool: [0x6aa6d7542310cdc75d1179b8729e1e6ec8d42bf1](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x6aa6d7542310cdc75d1179b8729e1e6ec8d42bf100020000000000000000064b)
Gauge: [0x94981eB72dB7EBcAE91ABd5A810f34B1DBf21108](https://etherscan.io/address/0x94981eB72dB7EBcAE91ABd5A810f34B1DBf21108)

sFRAX/4POOL - Arbitrum 
Pool: [0x2CE4457aCac29dA4736aE6f5Cd9F583a6b335c27](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x2CE4457aCac29dA4736aE6f5Cd9F583a6b335c27#readContract)
Child: [0x050fBe33699E56B577c3D6f090eCE9870A0966bd](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x050fBe33699E56B577c3D6f090eCE9870A0966bd)
Root: [0x62A82FE26E21a8807599374CaC8024fae342eF83](https://etherscan.io/address/0x62A82FE26E21a8807599374CaC8024fae342eF83)

sFRAX/wstETH - Arbitrum
Pool:  [0xc757f12694f550d0985ad6e1019c4db4a803f160](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xc757f12694f550d0985ad6e1019c4db4a803f1600002000000000000000004de)
Child: [0xeBF2d1995f9bBEa5CE689945b87CA4B5a033B653](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xeBF2d1995f9bBEa5CE689945b87CA4B5a033B653)
Root: [0xBE0FC6A0cc4eeeB168dfbDA75523c43dFE7D1F9C](https://etherscan.io/address/0xBE0FC6A0cc4eeeB168dfbDA75523c43dFE7D1F9C)

**Specification:**

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xF6A7ad46b00300344C7d4739C0518db70e722DC4`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

gauge(address): `0x94981eB72dB7EBcAE91ABd5A810f34B1DBf21108`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

gauge(address): `0x62A82FE26E21a8807599374CaC8024fae342eF83`
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

gauge(address): `0xBE0FC6A0cc4eeeB168dfbDA75523c43dFE7D1F9C`
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

The pool will have the `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal to enable PRF/WETH (80/20) gauges with a 2% emission cap on Arbitrum to deepen liquidity via gauge incentives.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous and stable early vote support for enabling the gauge.
Proposal aims to boost liquidity and reduce price volatility in the PRF/WETH Balancer pool.
Similar past proposals with gauge enables had strong yes votes indicating community precedent.
key_arguments_against: Limited forum discussion with some negative sentiment regarding proposal details.
Historical adjacent proposals showed post-vote price and TVL declines, signaling potential risks.
Forum sentiment does not fully align with strong vote support, suggesting some community caution.

evidence.quote: Timeline analysis shows unanimous support with lead ratio of 1.0 for 'Yes, let's do it' throughout voting period.
Two forum posts with sentiment: 1 Negative detailed post explaining the proposal, 1 Neutral post linking snapshot.
Similar proposals had unanimous yes votes but post-vote token price and TVL declines were observed.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline analytics, forum sentiment, and historical lessons rather than final tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for enabling the PRF/WETH gauge, indicating clear community backing through votes.
- Forum sentiment is limited and slightly negative, showing some community concerns but not enough to outweigh vote trends.
- Historical similar proposals enabled new gauges with unanimous votes but resulted in post-vote price and TVL declines, advising cautious optimism.
- Market impact metrics are positive for price and TVL, supporting the proposal's goal to deepen liquidity.
- Overall, the recommendation aligns with vote data and long-term benefit of enhanced liquidity, while noting some sentiment divergence.
